properties.title: Rome
properties.description: The lofty center of the Roman Empire!

properties.title: Hibernia
properties.description: Although Ireland is not thought of as a formal colony of the Roman Empire, Roman troops did visit, leaving behind archeological remains.

properties.title: Kushan Empire
properties.description: The Kushan Empire grew famous in the classical era as a pepper producer; pepper was very expensive commodity in Roman times.

properties.title: Thinae
properties.description: Thinae, or Xi'an, is described by Ptolemy as a "land of silk". Here, silk products began their journey on the Silk Road, which would eventually make its way to the Roman Empire.
